history.text: Wow, a good choice for the movie, imho....
i watched this one in a drive in theater. it was amazing
I'm sure it was!  I've been a big Marvel fan for 40 years, this was one of the best ones.
My favorite scene has to be the hulk's puny god scene with loki
Yes, my gf cracked up on that one.  And they made a subtle reference to it in Thor-Ragnarok as well.
i cant wait to get my hands on that one, havent had an opprotunity to watch it yet
It's easily the best Thor one and sets up the ones coming out this year with Thanos and GotG.  Loki is well portrayed as well!
to be honest Loki has always been my favorite marvel character. he is a fairly balanced character, which can be extremely difficult to do in film because you only see him from an outside perspective.

I agree, he shows some character growth in Ragnarok as well, instead of completely reverting to his villainous ways.  He was awesome in Avengers but if he's going to be in several movies his character needs to evolve.

which i can admire as an aspiring novelist. the one character that just doesn't sit well with me is Tony stark. its hard to place why i don'
t quite like this film's version.
perhaps its just that Tony stark either comes off as cocky, or confident. and this time round it came out as overly cocky.

Interesting.  I thought Robert Downey Jr nailed the arrogance and charisma of Stark even better than the comics.  Especially since the first Iron Man movie, he's evolved a good bit as well.  Watching him and Cap go head to head over philosophical difference in Winter Soldier was fun to watch because I could see both points of view.

I see the cockiness as part of Stark.  The growth he's showing is moving beyond that and seeing other's viewpoints, to the point where he's conceding that the Avengers need to be under someone else's control.

its a delicate point to balance, because it rests entirely on the audience's viewpoint. just like the plot is hard to balance in any superhero movie, especially if your going at it from an angle of just barely beating the villan. i agree that winter soldier was an excellent portrayal of the relationship between Cap and tony, but it kinda feels thike the director was trying to avoid that aspect in this film.
and that to me is a neccecary part of the character of stark.

Avengers came out well before Winter Soldier, so I see the change from too cocky to still cocky but conceding that things need to change and maybe he needs to change too.  Stark agreeing that the Avengers need oversight and trying to argue other team members to see it that way as well shows he finally sees it's not all about him and his ego.
No one here now?
It says User 2 has left
I'm going to keep posting a few more.
And Joss Whedon is awesome!
I've been a Whedon fan since Buffy and Firefly.
Plus, new Avengers movie is out this year!
Yay!
Okay, a couple more...
And then I'm gone.
To go home.
Cool...

uid1response.feedback: I think User 2 left early, not sure....
